Reference ID: Agricarbon - Field Operator - contractor

title: Full Stack Software Engineer Intern Fall 2024, FY24 (Meraki)
Field Operator
description:
Job title: Field Operator - contractor

Location: UK and Europe (training and HQ at Dundee)

Term: Contractor basis

Salary: £250/day (+ additional per diem allowance of 190 euros/day for accommodation/subsistence during mainland European work only)

Dates: initial work throughout Feb – March 24. Follow on work TBC.

About Agricarbon UK

Agricarbon is an ambitious start-up in the fast-emerging soil carbon space. Demand for carbon removals is forecast to grow exponentially in the next few decades, and it has been estimated that agricultural soils have the capacity to capture up to 1 trillion tonnes of CO2 through regenerative farming practices.

Agricarbon develops innovative technology-based services that measure soil carbon with the highest level of accuracy and at ultra-low cost. This is a vital missing link to allow soil carbon capture projects to demonstrate and secure payments for CO2 removal, unlocking farm soils as a vast carbon sink opportunity. Our aim is to make a meaningful contribution to mitigating climate change within the next 10 years.

Based in Dundee, Scotland, Agricarbon is targeting established international carbon removal markets whilst simultaneously helping to develop the soil carbon market in the UK and Europe. Through science-led innovation in automation and systems engineering, Agricarbon aims to set a global gold standard for reliable, affordable soil carbon certification and unleash a new wave of climate mitigating regenerative farming practices.

We have recently completed Series A fundraising to scale our operations rapidly and have multiple contracts to fulfil for large food and beverage companies/project developers in the UK, Europe and internationally.

Role summary

This is an exciting opportunity to play a front line, hand’s-on role in operating Agricarbon’s cutting edge soil sampling platform and capability.

As a Field Operator you will report directly to the Field Operations Manager. You will operate Agricarbon’s on-field machinery (an ATV and rear mounted soil sampling machine) and primarily be responsible for the successful extraction of high quality soil cores with specialist equipment and collecting all associated data via a mobile app.

While you will work your own platform, you will often work together with another operator running a second platform on the same farm. You will be responsible for taking care of all your equipment, including daily and weekly maintenance. Comprehensive training will be provided by Agricarbon at the Dundee facility to cover all your delegated responsibilities.

You will work with and be supported by a wider support team in Agricarbon for all logistical requirements to ensure successful sampling operations. You will be required to work anywhere in the UK or Europe, for periods of up to 12 days in a row, during which Agricarbon will cover all expenses and provide an additional per diem allowance for European work.

Responsibilities

· Daily operation of soil sampling platform (ATV mounted, petrol/hydraulic-powered soil sampler).

· Collection of physical soil samples from pre-planned locations in line with mobile app/GPS

· Capture of all soil sample data via mobile app.

· Navigation from farm to farm, sometimes covering large distances.

· Navigation of farm and fields safely and respectfully

· Liaison with farmers to plan and confirm sampling visits, access to sites, any relevant matters

· Transportation of soil sampling equipment and consumables to site

· On-field troubleshooting

· Collating of soil cores in pallet crates

· Daily/weekly maintenance, upkeep and cleaning of soil extraction equipment

· Communication with Team Lead/Operations Manager with essential information, useful feedback, etc.

Skills and experience

You must have:

· Necessary practical skills to operate equipment alone

· A UK Cat B+E driving license (if you have a Cat B license, this can be automatically updated to B+E due to recent UK rules change)

· Understanding of H&S and evidence of being able to adhere to safety protocols

· Experience in basic vehicle/equipment maintenance

· A good level of physical fitness and resilience for working outdoors

Nice if you have

· First Aid trained

· Some experience operating hydraulic machinery

· Previous soil sampling experience

· Vehicle mechanic skills

· Experience towing trailers with heavy loads

· ATV off-road driving experience and well versed with the countryside code in the UK, or working in a farming environment

· IT and data entry skills on mobile phones and laptop

· Good communication skills

Personal characteristics

You are a highly self-motivated, self disciplined, friendly, punctual and diligent individual who takes pride in carrying out your work efficiently and to a high standard. You are proactive and hands-on, able to solve problems when they arise either independently or as part of a team. We hope you will be inspired by our mission and motivated to help the wider team succeed.

Application process

1. Email your CV and a covering note explaining why you believe you are a good fit for the role

2. Video call interview

3. Face to face interview and field trial

Job Types: Temporary contract, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 2 months

Salary: £250.00 per day

Benefits:

  • Free or subsidised travel

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Licence/Certification:

  • Driving Licence (required)

Willingness to travel:

  • 100% (required)

Work Location: On the road

You will work with and be supported by a wider support team in Agricarbon for all logistical requirements to ensure successful sampling operations. You will be required to work anywhere in the UK or Europe, for periods of up to 12 days in a row, during which Agricarbon will cover all expenses and provide an additional per diem allowance for European work.

Responsibilities

· Daily operation of soil sampling platform (ATV mounted, petrol/hydraulic-powered soil sampler).

· Collection of physical soil samples from pre-planned locations in line with mobile app/GPS

· Capture of all soil sample data via mobile app.

· Navigation from farm to farm, sometimes covering large distances.

· Navigation of farm and fields safely and respectfully

· Liaison with farmers to plan and confirm sampling visits, access to sites, any relevant matters

· Transportation of soil sampling equipment and consumables to site

· On-field troubleshooting

· Collating of soil cores in pallet crates

· Daily/weekly maintenance, upkeep and cleaning of soil extraction equipment

· Communication with Team Lead/Operations Manager with essential information, useful feedback, etc.

Skills and experience

You must have:

· Necessary practical skills to operate equipment alone

· A UK Cat B+E driving license (if you have a Cat B license, this can be automatically updated to B+E due to recent UK rules change)

· Understanding of H&S and evidence of being able to adhere to safety protocols

· Experience in basic vehicle/equipment maintenance

· A good level of physical fitness and resilience for working outdoors

Nice if you have

· First Aid trained

· Some experience operating hydraulic machinery

· Previous soil sampling experience

· Vehicle mechanic skills

· Experience towing trailers with heavy loads

· ATV off-road driving experience and well versed with the countryside code in the UK, or working in a farming environment

· IT and data entry skills on mobile phones and laptop

· Good communication skills

Personal characteristics

You are a highly self-motivated, self disciplined, friendly, punctual and diligent individual who takes pride in carrying out your work efficiently and to a high standard. You are proactive and hands-on, able to solve problems when they arise either independently or as part of a team. We hope you will be inspired by our mission and motivated to help the wider team succeed.

Application process

2. Video call interview

3. Face to face interview and field trial

Agricarbon is an ambitious start-up in the fast-emerging soil carbon space. Demand for carbon removals is forecast to grow exponentially in the next few decades, and it has been estimated that agricultural soils have the capacity to capture up to 1 trillion tonnes of CO2 through regenerative farming practices.

Agricarbon develops innovative technology-based services that measure soil carbon with the highest level of accuracy and at ultra-low cost. This is a vital missing link to allow soil carbon capture projects to demonstrate and secure payments for CO2 removal, unlocking farm soils as a vast carbon sink opportunity. Our aim is to make a meaningful contribution to mitigating climate change within the next 10 years.

Based in Dundee, Scotland, Agricarbon is targeting established international carbon removal markets whilst simultaneously helping to develop the soil carbon market in the UK and Europe. Through science-led innovation in automation and systems engineering, Agricarbon aims to set a global gold standard for reliable, affordable soil carbon certification and unleash a new wave of climate mitigating regenerative farming practices.

We have recently completed Series A fundraising to scale our operations rapidly and have multiple contracts to fulfil for large food and beverage companies/project developers in the UK, Europe and internationally.

Reference ID: Agricarbon - Field Operator - contractor

title: Field Operator
description:
Job title: Field Operator - contractor

Location: UK and Europe (training and HQ at Dundee)

Term: Contractor basis

Salary: £250/day (+ additional per diem allowance of 190 euros/day for accommodation/subsistence during mainland European work only)

Dates: initial work throughout Feb – March 24. Follow on work TBC.

About Agricarbon UK

Agricarbon is an ambitious start-up in the fast-emerging soil carbon space. Demand for carbon removals is forecast to grow exponentially in the next few decades, and it has been estimated that agricultural soils have the capacity to capture up to 1 trillion tonnes of CO2 through regenerative farming practices.

Agricarbon develops innovative technology-based services that measure soil carbon with the highest level of accuracy and at ultra-low cost. This is a vital missing link to allow soil carbon capture projects to demonstrate and secure payments for CO2 removal, unlocking farm soils as a vast carbon sink opportunity. Our aim is to make a meaningful contribution to mitigating climate change within the next 10 years.

Based in Dundee, Scotland, Agricarbon is targeting established international carbon removal markets whilst simultaneously helping to develop the soil carbon market in the UK and Europe. Through science-led innovation in automation and systems engineering, Agricarbon aims to set a global gold standard for reliable, affordable soil carbon certification and unleash a new wave of climate mitigating regenerative farming practices.

We have recently completed Series A fundraising to scale our operations rapidly and have multiple contracts to fulfil for large food and beverage companies/project developers in the UK, Europe and internationally.

Role summary

This is an exciting opportunity to play a front line, hand’s-on role in operating Agricarbon’s cutting edge soil sampling platform and capability.

As a Field Operator you will report directly to the Field Operations Manager. You will operate Agricarbon’s on-field machinery (an ATV and rear mounted soil sampling machine) and primarily be responsible for the successful extraction of high quality soil cores with specialist equipment and collecting all associated data via a mobile app.

While you will work your own platform, you will often work together with another operator running a second platform on the same farm. You will be responsible for taking care of all your equipment, including daily and weekly maintenance. Comprehensive training will be provided by Agricarbon at the Dundee facility to cover all your delegated responsibilities.

You will work with and be supported by a wider support team in Agricarbon for all logistical requirements to ensure successful sampling operations. You will be required to work anywhere in the UK or Europe, for periods of up to 12 days in a row, during which Agricarbon will cover all expenses and provide an additional per diem allowance for European work.

Responsibilities

· Daily operation of soil sampling platform (ATV mounted, petrol/hydraulic-powered soil sampler).

· Collection of physical soil samples from pre-planned locations in line with mobile app/GPS

· Capture of all soil sample data via mobile app.

· Navigation from farm to farm, sometimes covering large distances.

· Navigation of farm and fields safely and respectfully

· Liaison with farmers to plan and confirm sampling visits, access to sites, any relevant matters

· Transportation of soil sampling equipment and consumables to site

· On-field troubleshooting

· Collating of soil cores in pallet crates

· Daily/weekly maintenance, upkeep and cleaning of soil extraction equipment

· Communication with Team Lead/Operations Manager with essential information, useful feedback, etc.

Skills and experience

You must have:

· Necessary practical skills to operate equipment alone

· A UK Cat B+E driving license (if you have a Cat B license, this can be automatically updated to B+E due to recent UK rules change)

· Understanding of H&S and evidence of being able to adhere to safety protocols

· Experience in basic vehicle/equipment maintenance

· A good level of physical fitness and resilience for working outdoors

Nice if you have

· First Aid trained

· Some experience operating hydraulic machinery

· Previous soil sampling experience

· Vehicle mechanic skills

· Experience towing trailers with heavy loads

· ATV off-road driving experience and well versed with the countryside code in the UK, or working in a farming environment

· IT and data entry skills on mobile phones and laptop

· Good communication skills

Personal characteristics

You are a highly self-motivated, self disciplined, friendly, punctual and diligent individual who takes pride in carrying out your work efficiently and to a high standard. You are proactive and hands-on, able to solve problems when they arise either independently or as part of a team. We hope you will be inspired by our mission and motivated to help the wider team succeed.

Application process

1. Email your CV and a covering note explaining why you believe you are a good fit for the role

2. Video call interview

3. Face to face interview and field trial

Job Types: Temporary contract, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 2 months

Salary: £250.00 per day

Benefits:

  • Free or subsidised travel

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Licence/Certification:

  • Driving Licence (required)

Willingness to travel:

  • 100% (required)

Work Location: On the road

While you will work your own platform, you will often work together with another operator running a second platform on the same farm. You will be responsible for taking care of all your equipment, including daily and weekly maintenance. Comprehensive training will be provided by Agricarbon at the Dundee facility to cover all your delegated responsibilities.

You will work with and be supported by a wider support team in Agricarbon for all logistical requirements to ensure successful sampling operations. You will be required to work anywhere in the UK or Europe, for periods of up to 12 days in a row, during which Agricarbon will cover all expenses and provide an additional per diem allowance for European work.

Responsibilities

· Daily operation of soil sampling platform (ATV mounted, petrol/hydraulic-powered soil sampler).

· Collection of physical soil samples from pre-planned locations in line with mobile app/GPS

· Capture of all soil sample data via mobile app.

· Navigation from farm to farm, sometimes covering large distances.

· Navigation of farm and fields safely and respectfully

· Liaison with farmers to plan and confirm sampling visits, access to sites, any relevant matters

· Transportation of soil sampling equipment and consumables to site

· On-field troubleshooting

· Collating of soil cores in pallet crates

· Daily/weekly maintenance, upkeep and cleaning of soil extraction equipment

· Communication with Team Lead/Operations Manager with essential information, useful feedback, etc.

Skills and experience

You must have:

· Necessary practical skills to operate equipment alone

· A UK Cat B+E driving license (if you have a Cat B license, this can be automatically updated to B+E due to recent UK rules change)

· Understanding of H&S and evidence of being able to adhere to safety protocols

· Experience in basic vehicle/equipment maintenance

· A good level of physical fitness and resilience for working outdoors

Nice if you have

· First Aid trained

· Some experience operating hydraulic machinery

· Previous soil sampling experience

· Vehicle mechanic skills

· Experience towing trailers with heavy loads

· ATV off-road driving experience and well versed with the countryside code in the UK, or working in a farming environment

· IT and data entry skills on mobile phones and laptop

· Good communication skills

Personal characteristics

You are a highly self-motivated, self disciplined, friendly, punctual and diligent individual who takes pride in carrying out your work efficiently and to a high standard. You are proactive and hands-on, able to solve problems when they arise either independently or as part of a team. We hope you will be inspired by our mission and motivated to help the wider team succeed.

Application process

1. Email your CV and a covering note explaining why you believe you are a good fit for the role

2. Video call interview

3. Face to face interview and field trial

Job Types: Temporary contract, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 2 months

Salary: £250.00 per day

Benefits:

  • Free or subsidised travel

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Licence/Certification:

  • Driving Licence (required)

Willingness to travel:

  • 100% (required)

Work Location: On the road

About Agricarbon UK

Agricarbon is an ambitious start-up in the fast-emerging soil carbon space. Demand for carbon removals is forecast to grow exponentially in the next few decades, and it has been estimated that agricultural soils have the capacity to capture up to 1 trillion tonnes of CO2 through regenerative farming practices.

Agricarbon develops innovative technology-based services that measure soil carbon with the highest level of accuracy and at ultra-low cost. This is a vital missing link to allow soil carbon capture projects to demonstrate and secure payments for CO2 removal, unlocking farm soils as a vast carbon sink opportunity. Our aim is to make a meaningful contribution to mitigating climate change within the next 10 years.

Based in Dundee, Scotland, Agricarbon is targeting established international carbon removal markets whilst simultaneously helping to develop the soil carbon market in the UK and Europe. Through science-led innovation in automation and systems engineering, Agricarbon aims to set a global gold standard for reliable, affordable soil carbon certification and unleash a new wave of climate mitigating regenerative farming practices.

We have recently completed Series A fundraising to scale our operations rapidly and have multiple contracts to fulfil for large food and beverage companies/project developers in the UK, Europe and internationally.

Reference ID: Agricarbon - Field Operator - contractor

title: Field Operator
description:
Job title: Field Operator - contractor

Location: UK and Europe (training and HQ at Dundee)

Term: Contractor basis

Salary: £250/day (+ additional per diem allowance of 190 euros/day for accommodation/subsistence during mainland European work only)

Dates: initial work throughout Feb – March 24. Follow on work TBC.

About Agricarbon UK

Agricarbon is an ambitious start-up in the fast-emerging soil carbon space. Demand for carbon removals is forecast to grow exponentially in the next few decades, and it has been estimated that agricultural soils have the capacity to capture up to 1 trillion tonnes of CO2 through regenerative farming practices.

Agricarbon develops innovative technology-based services that measure soil carbon with the highest level of accuracy and at ultra-low cost. This is a vital missing link to allow soil carbon capture projects to demonstrate and secure payments for CO2 removal, unlocking farm soils as a vast carbon sink opportunity. Our aim is to make a meaningful contribution to mitigating climate change within the next 10 years.

Based in Dundee, Scotland, Agricarbon is targeting established international carbon removal markets whilst simultaneously helping to develop the soil carbon market in the UK and Europe. Through science-led innovation in automation and systems engineering, Agricarbon aims to set a global gold standard for reliable, affordable soil carbon certification and unleash a new wave of climate mitigating regenerative farming practices.

We have recently completed Series A fundraising to scale our operations rapidly and have multiple contracts to fulfil for large food and beverage companies/project developers in the UK, Europe and internationally.

Role summary

This is an exciting opportunity to play a front line, hand’s-on role in operating Agricarbon’s cutting edge soil sampling platform and capability.

As a Field Operator you will report directly to the Field Operations Manager. You will operate Agricarbon’s on-field machinery (an ATV and rear mounted soil sampling machine) and primarily be responsible for the successful extraction of high quality soil cores with specialist equipment and collecting all associated data via a mobile app.

While you will work your own platform, you will often work together with another operator running a second platform on the same farm. You will be responsible for taking care of all your equipment, including daily and weekly maintenance. Comprehensive training will be provided by Agricarbon at the Dundee facility to cover all your delegated responsibilities.

You will work with and be supported by a wider support team in Agricarbon for all logistical requirements to ensure successful sampling operations. You will be required to work anywhere in the UK or Europe, for periods of up to 12 days in a row, during which Agricarbon will cover all expenses and provide an additional per diem allowance for European work.

Responsibilities

· Daily operation of soil sampling platform (ATV mounted, petrol/hydraulic-powered soil sampler).

· Collection of physical soil samples from pre-planned locations in line with mobile app/GPS

· Capture of all soil sample data via mobile app.

· Navigation from farm to farm, sometimes covering large distances.

· Navigation of farm and fields safely and respectfully

· Liaison with farmers to plan and confirm sampling visits, access to sites, any relevant matters

· Transportation of soil sampling equipment and consumables to site

· On-field troubleshooting

· Collating of soil cores in pallet crates

· Daily/weekly maintenance, upkeep and cleaning of soil extraction equipment

· Communication with Team Lead/Operations Manager with essential information, useful feedback, etc.

Skills and experience

You must have:

· Necessary practical skills to operate equipment alone

· A UK Cat B+E driving license (if you have a Cat B license, this can be automatically updated to B+E due to recent UK rules change)

· Understanding of H&S and evidence of being able to adhere to safety protocols

· Experience in basic vehicle/equipment maintenance

· A good level of physical fitness and resilience for working outdoors

Nice if you have

· First Aid trained

· Some experience operating hydraulic machinery

· Previous soil sampling experience

· Vehicle mechanic skills

· Experience towing trailers with heavy loads

· ATV off-road driving experience and well versed with the countryside code in the UK, or working in a farming environment

· IT and data entry skills on mobile phones and laptop

· Good communication skills

Personal characteristics

You are a highly self-motivated, self disciplined, friendly, punctual and diligent individual who takes pride in carrying out your work efficiently and to a high standard. You are proactive and hands-on, able to solve problems when they arise either independently or as part of a team. We hope you will be inspired by our mission and motivated to help the wider team succeed.

Application process

1. Email your CV and a covering note explaining why you believe you are a good fit for the role

2. Video call interview

3. Face to face interview and field trial

Job Types: Temporary contract, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 2 months

Salary: £250.00 per day

Benefits:

  • Free or subsidised travel

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Licence/Certification:

  • Driving Licence (required)

Willingness to travel:

  • 100% (required)

Work Location: On the road

We have recently completed Series A fundraising to scale our operations rapidly and have multiple contracts to fulfil for large food and beverage companies/project developers in the UK, Europe and internationally.

Role summary

This is an exciting opportunity to play a front line, hand’s-on role in operating Agricarbon’s cutting edge soil sampling platform and capability.

As a Field Operator you will report directly to the Field Operations Manager. You will operate Agricarbon’s on-field machinery (an ATV and rear mounted soil sampling machine) and primarily be responsible for the successful extraction of high quality soil cores with specialist equipment and collecting all associated data via a mobile app.

While you will work your own platform, you will often work together with another operator running a second platform on the same farm. You will be responsible for taking care of all your equipment, including daily and weekly maintenance. Comprehensive training will be provided by Agricarbon at the Dundee facility to cover all your delegated responsibilities.

You will work with and be supported by a wider support team in Agricarbon for all logistical requirements to ensure successful sampling operations. You will be required to work anywhere in the UK or Europe, for periods of up to 12 days in a row, during which Agricarbon will cover all expenses and provide an additional per diem allowance for European work.

Responsibilities

· Daily operation of soil sampling platform (ATV mounted, petrol/hydraulic-powered soil sampler).

· Collection of physical soil samples from pre-planned locations in line with mobile app/GPS

· Capture of all soil sample data via mobile app.

· Navigation from farm to farm, sometimes covering large distances.

· Navigation of farm and fields safely and respectfully

· Liaison with farmers to plan and confirm sampling visits, access to sites, any relevant matters

· Transportation of soil sampling equipment and consumables to site

· On-field troubleshooting

· Collating of soil cores in pallet crates

· Daily/weekly maintenance, upkeep and cleaning of soil extraction equipment

· Communication with Team Lead/Operations Manager with essential information, useful feedback, etc.

Skills and experience

You must have:

· Necessary practical skills to operate equipment alone

· A UK Cat B+E driving license (if you have a Cat B license, this can be automatically updated to B+E due to recent UK rules change)

· Understanding of H&S and evidence of being able to adhere to safety protocols

· Experience in basic vehicle/equipment maintenance

· A good level of physical fitness and resilience for working outdoors

Nice if you have

· First Aid trained

· Some experience operating hydraulic machinery

· Previous soil sampling experience

· Vehicle mechanic skills

· Experience towing trailers with heavy loads

· ATV off-road driving experience and well versed with the countryside code in the UK, or working in a farming environment

· IT and data entry skills on mobile phones and laptop

· Good communication skills

Personal characteristics

You are a highly self-motivated, self disciplined, friendly, punctual and diligent individual who takes pride in carrying out your work efficiently and to a high standard. You are proactive and hands-on, able to solve problems when they arise either independently or as part of a team. We hope you will be inspired by our mission and motivated to help the wider team succeed.

Application process

1. Email your CV and a covering note explaining why you believe you are a good fit for the role

2. Video call interview

3. Face to face interview and field trial

Job Types: Temporary contract, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 2 months

Salary: £250.00 per day

Benefits:

  • Free or subsidised travel

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Licence/Certification:

  • Driving Licence (required)

Willingness to travel:

  • 100% (required)

Work Location: On the road

· Experience in basic vehicle/equipment maintenance

· A good level of physical fitness and resilience for working outdoors

Nice if you have

· First Aid trained

· Some experience operating hydraulic machinery

· Vehicle mechanic skills

· Experience towing trailers with heavy loads

· ATV off-road driving experience and well versed with the countryside code in the UK, or working in a farming environment

· IT and data entry skills on mobile phones and laptop

· Good communication skills

You are a highly self-motivated, self disciplined, friendly, punctual and diligent individual who takes pride in carrying out your work efficiently and to a high standard. You are proactive and hands-on, able to solve problems when they arise either independently or as part of a team. We hope you will be inspired by our mission and motivated to help the wider team succeed.

title: Field Operator
description:
Job title: Field Operator - contractor

Location: UK and Europe (training and HQ at Dundee)

Term: Contractor basis

Salary: £250/day (+ additional per diem allowance of 190 euros/day for accommodation/subsistence during mainland European work only)

Dates: initial work throughout Feb – March 24. Follow on work TBC.

About Agricarbon UK

Agricarbon is an ambitious start-up in the fast-emerging soil carbon space. Demand for carbon removals is forecast to grow exponentially in the next few decades, and it has been estimated that agricultural soils have the capacity to capture up to 1 trillion tonnes of CO2 through regenerative farming practices.

Agricarbon develops innovative technology-based services that measure soil carbon with the highest level of accuracy and at ultra-low cost. This is a vital missing link to allow soil carbon capture projects to demonstrate and secure payments for CO2 removal, unlocking farm soils as a vast carbon sink opportunity. Our aim is to make a meaningful contribution to mitigating climate change within the next 10 years.

Based in Dundee, Scotland, Agricarbon is targeting established international carbon removal markets whilst simultaneously helping to develop the soil carbon market in the UK and Europe. Through science-led innovation in automation and systems engineering, Agricarbon aims to set a global gold standard for reliable, affordable soil carbon certification and unleash a new wave of climate mitigating regenerative farming practices.

We have recently completed Series A fundraising to scale our operations rapidly and have multiple contracts to fulfil for large food and beverage companies/project developers in the UK, Europe and internationally.

Role summary

This is an exciting opportunity to play a front line, hand’s-on role in operating Agricarbon’s cutting edge soil sampling platform and capability.

As a Field Operator you will report directly to the Field Operations Manager. You will operate Agricarbon’s on-field machinery (an ATV and rear mounted soil sampling machine) and primarily be responsible for the successful extraction of high quality soil cores with specialist equipment and collecting all associated data via a mobile app.

While you will work your own platform, you will often work together with another operator running a second platform on the same farm. You will be responsible for taking care of all your equipment, including daily and weekly maintenance. Comprehensive training will be provided by Agricarbon at the Dundee facility to cover all your delegated responsibilities.

You will work with and be supported by a wider support team in Agricarbon for all logistical requirements to ensure successful sampling operations. You will be required to work anywhere in the UK or Europe, for periods of up to 12 days in a row, during which Agricarbon will cover all expenses and provide an additional per diem allowance for European work.

Responsibilities

· Daily operation of soil sampling platform (ATV mounted, petrol/hydraulic-powered soil sampler).

· Collection of physical soil samples from pre-planned locations in line with mobile app/GPS

· Capture of all soil sample data via mobile app.

· Navigation from farm to farm, sometimes covering large distances.

· Navigation of farm and fields safely and respectfully

· Liaison with farmers to plan and confirm sampling visits, access to sites, any relevant matters

· Transportation of soil sampling equipment and consumables to site

· On-field troubleshooting

· Collating of soil cores in pallet crates

· Daily/weekly maintenance, upkeep and cleaning of soil extraction equipment

· Communication with Team Lead/Operations Manager with essential information, useful feedback, etc.

Skills and experience

You must have:

· Necessary practical skills to operate equipment alone

· A UK Cat B+E driving license (if you have a Cat B license, this can be automatically updated to B+E due to recent UK rules change)

· Understanding of H&S and evidence of being able to adhere to safety protocols

· Experience in basic vehicle/equipment maintenance

· A good level of physical fitness and resilience for working outdoors

Nice if you have

· First Aid trained

· Some experience operating hydraulic machinery

· Previous soil sampling experience

· Vehicle mechanic skills

· Experience towing trailers with heavy loads

· ATV off-road driving experience and well versed with the countryside code in the UK, or working in a farming environment

· IT and data entry skills on mobile phones and laptop

· Good communication skills

Personal characteristics

You are a highly self-motivated, self disciplined, friendly, punctual and diligent individual who takes pride in carrying out your work efficiently and to a high standard. You are proactive and hands-on, able to solve problems when they arise either independently or as part of a team. We hope you will be inspired by our mission and motivated to help the wider team succeed.

Application process

1. Email your CV and a covering note explaining why you believe you are a good fit for the role

2. Video call interview

3. Face to face interview and field trial

Contract length: 2 months

Salary: £250.00 per day

Benefits:

  • Free or subsidised travel

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

  • Driving Licence (required)

Agricarbon develops innovative technology-based services that measure soil carbon with the highest level of accuracy and at ultra-low cost. This is a vital missing link to allow soil carbon capture projects to demonstrate and secure payments for CO2 removal, unlocking farm soils as a vast carbon sink opportunity. Our aim is to make a meaningful contribution to mitigating climate change within the next 10 years.

Based in Dundee, Scotland, Agricarbon is targeting established international carbon removal markets whilst simultaneously helping to develop the soil carbon market in the UK and Europe. Through science-led innovation in automation and systems engineering, Agricarbon aims to set a global gold standard for reliable, affordable soil carbon certification and unleash a new wave of climate mitigating regenerative farming practices.

We have recently completed Series A fundraising to scale our operations rapidly and have multiple contracts to fulfil for large food and beverage companies/project developers in the UK, Europe and internationally.

Role summary

This is an exciting opportunity to play a front line, hand’s-on role in operating Agricarbon’s cutting edge soil sampling platform and capability.

As a Field Operator you will report directly to the Field Operations Manager. You will operate Agricarbon’s on-field machinery (an ATV and rear mounted soil sampling machine) and primarily be responsible for the successful extraction of high quality soil cores with specialist equipment and collecting all associated data via a mobile app.

While you will work your own platform, you will often work together with another operator running a second platform on the same farm. You will be responsible for taking care of all your equipment, including daily and weekly maintenance. Comprehensive training will be provided by Agricarbon at the Dundee facility to cover all your delegated responsibilities.

You will work with and be supported by a wider support team in Agricarbon for all logistical requirements to ensure successful sampling operations. You will be required to work anywhere in the UK or Europe, for periods of up to 12 days in a row, during which Agricarbon will cover all expenses and provide an additional per diem allowance for European work.

Responsibilities

· Daily operation of soil sampling platform (ATV mounted, petrol/hydraulic-powered soil sampler).

· Collection of physical soil samples from pre-planned locations in line with mobile app/GPS

· Capture of all soil sample data via mobile app.

· Navigation from farm to farm, sometimes covering large distances.

· Navigation of farm and fields safely and respectfully

· Liaison with farmers to plan and confirm sampling visits, access to sites, any relevant matters

· Transportation of soil sampling equipment and consumables to site

· On-field troubleshooting

· Collating of soil cores in pallet crates

· Daily/weekly maintenance, upkeep and cleaning of soil extraction equipment

· Communication with Team Lead/Operations Manager with essential information, useful feedback, etc.

Skills and experience

You must have:

· Necessary practical skills to operate equipment alone

· A UK Cat B+E driving license (if you have a Cat B license, this can be automatically updated to B+E due to recent UK rules change)

· Understanding of H&S and evidence of being able to adhere to safety protocols

· Experience in basic vehicle/equipment maintenance

· A good level of physical fitness and resilience for working outdoors

Nice if you have

· First Aid trained

· Some experience operating hydraulic machinery

· Previous soil sampling experience

· Vehicle mechanic skills

· Experience towing trailers with heavy loads

· ATV off-road driving experience and well versed with the countryside code in the UK, or working in a farming environment

· IT and data entry skills on mobile phones and laptop

· Good communication skills

Personal characteristics

You are a highly self-motivated, self disciplined, friendly, punctual and diligent individual who takes pride in carrying out your work efficiently and to a high standard. You are proactive and hands-on, able to solve problems when they arise either independently or as part of a team. We hope you will be inspired by our mission and motivated to help the wider team succeed.

Application process

1. Email your CV and a covering note explaining why you believe you are a good fit for the role

2. Video call interview

3. Face to face interview and field trial

Job Types: Temporary contract, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 2 months

Salary: £250.00 per day

Benefits:

  • Free or subsidised travel

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Licence/Certification:

  • Driving Licence (required)

Willingness to travel:

  • 100% (required)

Work Location: On the road

· On-field troubleshooting

· Collating of soil cores in pallet crates

· Daily/weekly maintenance, upkeep and cleaning of soil extraction equipment

Skills and experience

You must have:

· Necessary practical skills to operate equipment alone

· A UK Cat B+E driving license (if you have a Cat B license, this can be automatically updated to B+E due to recent UK rules change)

· Understanding of H&S and evidence of being able to adhere to safety protocols

· Experience in basic vehicle/equipment maintenance

· A good level of physical fitness and resilience for working outdoors

Nice if you have

· First Aid trained

· Some experience operating hydraulic machinery

· Previous soil sampling experience

· Vehicle mechanic skills

· ATV off-road driving experience and well versed with the countryside code in the UK, or working in a farming environment

· Good communication skills

description:
Job title: Field Operator - contractor

Location: UK and Europe (training and HQ at Dundee)

Term: Contractor basis

Salary: £250/day (+ additional per diem allowance of 190 euros/day for accommodation/subsistence during mainland European work only)

Dates: initial work throughout Feb – March 24. Follow on work TBC.

About Agricarbon UK

Agricarbon is an ambitious start-up in the fast-emerging soil carbon space. Demand for carbon removals is forecast to grow exponentially in the next few decades, and it has been estimated that agricultural soils have the capacity to capture up to 1 trillion tonnes of CO2 through regenerative farming practices.

Agricarbon develops innovative technology-based services that measure soil carbon with the highest level of accuracy and at ultra-low cost. This is a vital missing link to allow soil carbon capture projects to demonstrate and secure payments for CO2 removal, unlocking farm soils as a vast carbon sink opportunity. Our aim is to make a meaningful contribution to mitigating climate change within the next 10 years.

Based in Dundee, Scotland, Agricarbon is targeting established international carbon removal markets whilst simultaneously helping to develop the soil carbon market in the UK and Europe. Through science-led innovation in automation and systems engineering, Agricarbon aims to set a global gold standard for reliable, affordable soil carbon certification and unleash a new wave of climate mitigating regenerative farming practices.

We have recently completed Series A fundraising to scale our operations rapidly and have multiple contracts to fulfil for large food and beverage companies/project developers in the UK, Europe and internationally.

Role summary

This is an exciting opportunity to play a front line, hand’s-on role in operating Agricarbon’s cutting edge soil sampling platform and capability.

As a Field Operator you will report directly to the Field Operations Manager. You will operate Agricarbon’s on-field machinery (an ATV and rear mounted soil sampling machine) and primarily be responsible for the successful extraction of high quality soil cores with specialist equipment and collecting all associated data via a mobile app.

While you will work your own platform, you will often work together with another operator running a second platform on the same farm. You will be responsible for taking care of all your equipment, including daily and weekly maintenance. Comprehensive training will be provided by Agricarbon at the Dundee facility to cover all your delegated responsibilities.

You will work with and be supported by a wider support team in Agricarbon for all logistical requirements to ensure successful sampling operations. You will be required to work anywhere in the UK or Europe, for periods of up to 12 days in a row, during which Agricarbon will cover all expenses and provide an additional per diem allowance for European work.

Responsibilities

· Daily operation of soil sampling platform (ATV mounted, petrol/hydraulic-powered soil sampler).

· Collection of physical soil samples from pre-planned locations in line with mobile app/GPS

· Capture of all soil sample data via mobile app.

· Navigation from farm to farm, sometimes covering large distances.

· Navigation of farm and fields safely and respectfully

· Liaison with farmers to plan and confirm sampling visits, access to sites, any relevant matters

· Transportation of soil sampling equipment and consumables to site

· On-field troubleshooting

· Collating of soil cores in pallet crates

· Daily/weekly maintenance, upkeep and cleaning of soil extraction equipment

· Communication with Team Lead/Operations Manager with essential information, useful feedback, etc.

Skills and experience

You must have:

· Necessary practical skills to operate equipment alone

· A UK Cat B+E driving license (if you have a Cat B license, this can be automatically updated to B+E due to recent UK rules change)

· Understanding of H&S and evidence of being able to adhere to safety protocols

· Experience in basic vehicle/equipment maintenance

· A good level of physical fitness and resilience for working outdoors

Nice if you have

· First Aid trained

· Some experience operating hydraulic machinery

· Previous soil sampling experience

· Vehicle mechanic skills

· Experience towing trailers with heavy loads

· ATV off-road driving experience and well versed with the countryside code in the UK, or working in a farming environment

· IT and data entry skills on mobile phones and laptop

· Good communication skills

Personal characteristics

You are a highly self-motivated, self disciplined, friendly, punctual and diligent individual who takes pride in carrying out your work efficiently and to a high standard. You are proactive and hands-on, able to solve problems when they arise either independently or as part of a team. We hope you will be inspired by our mission and motivated to help the wider team succeed.

Application process

1. Email your CV and a covering note explaining why you believe you are a good fit for the role

2. Video call interview

3. Face to face interview and field trial

description:
Job title: Field Operator - contractor

Location: UK and Europe (training and HQ at Dundee)

Term: Contractor basis

Salary: £250/day (+ additional per diem allowance of 190 euros/day for accommodation/subsistence during mainland European work only)

Dates: initial work throughout Feb – March 24. Follow on work TBC.

About Agricarbon UK

Agricarbon is an ambitious start-up in the fast-emerging soil carbon space. Demand for carbon removals is forecast to grow exponentially in the next few decades, and it has been estimated that agricultural soils have the capacity to capture up to 1 trillion tonnes of CO2 through regenerative farming practices.

Agricarbon develops innovative technology-based services that measure soil carbon with the highest level of accuracy and at ultra-low cost. This is a vital missing link to allow soil carbon capture projects to demonstrate and secure payments for CO2 removal, unlocking farm soils as a vast carbon sink opportunity. Our aim is to make a meaningful contribution to mitigating climate change within the next 10 years.

Based in Dundee, Scotland, Agricarbon is targeting established international carbon removal markets whilst simultaneously helping to develop the soil carbon market in the UK and Europe. Through science-led innovation in automation and systems engineering, Agricarbon aims to set a global gold standard for reliable, affordable soil carbon certification and unleash a new wave of climate mitigating regenerative farming practices.

We have recently completed Series A fundraising to scale our operations rapidly and have multiple contracts to fulfil for large food and beverage companies/project developers in the UK, Europe and internationally.

Role summary

This is an exciting opportunity to play a front line, hand’s-on role in operating Agricarbon’s cutting edge soil sampling platform and capability.

As a Field Operator you will report directly to the Field Operations Manager. You will operate Agricarbon’s on-field machinery (an ATV and rear mounted soil sampling machine) and primarily be responsible for the successful extraction of high quality soil cores with specialist equipment and collecting all associated data via a mobile app.

While you will work your own platform, you will often work together with another operator running a second platform on the same farm. You will be responsible for taking care of all your equipment, including daily and weekly maintenance. Comprehensive training will be provided by Agricarbon at the Dundee facility to cover all your delegated responsibilities.

You will work with and be supported by a wider support team in Agricarbon for all logistical requirements to ensure successful sampling operations. You will be required to work anywhere in the UK or Europe, for periods of up to 12 days in a row, during which Agricarbon will cover all expenses and provide an additional per diem allowance for European work.

Responsibilities

· Daily operation of soil sampling platform (ATV mounted, petrol/hydraulic-powered soil sampler).

· Collection of physical soil samples from pre-planned locations in line with mobile app/GPS

· Capture of all soil sample data via mobile app.

· Navigation from farm to farm, sometimes covering large distances.

· Navigation of farm and fields safely and respectfully

· Liaison with farmers to plan and confirm sampling visits, access to sites, any relevant matters

· Transportation of soil sampling equipment and consumables to site

· On-field troubleshooting

· Collating of soil cores in pallet crates

· Daily/weekly maintenance, upkeep and cleaning of soil extraction equipment

· Communication with Team Lead/Operations Manager with essential information, useful feedback, etc.

Skills and experience

You must have:

· Necessary practical skills to operate equipment alone

· A UK Cat B+E driving license (if you have a Cat B license, this can be automatically updated to B+E due to recent UK rules change)

· Understanding of H&S and evidence of being able to adhere to safety protocols

· Experience in basic vehicle/equipment maintenance

· A good level of physical fitness and resilience for working outdoors

Nice if you have

· First Aid trained

· Some experience operating hydraulic machinery

· Previous soil sampling experience

· Vehicle mechanic skills

· Experience towing trailers with heavy loads

· ATV off-road driving experience and well versed with the countryside code in the UK, or working in a farming environment

· IT and data entry skills on mobile phones and laptop

· Good communication skills

Personal characteristics

You are a highly self-motivated, self disciplined, friendly, punctual and diligent individual who takes pride in carrying out your work efficiently and to a high standard. You are proactive and hands-on, able to solve problems when they arise either independently or as part of a team. We hope you will be inspired by our mission and motivated to help the wider team succeed.

Application process

1. Email your CV and a covering note explaining why you believe you are a good fit for the role

2. Video call interview

3. Face to face interview and field trial

Job Types: Temporary contract, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 2 months

Salary: £250.00 per day

Benefits:

  • Free or subsidised travel

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Licence/Certification:

  • Driving Licence (required)

Willingness to travel:

  • 100% (required)

Work Location: On the road

Reference ID: Agricarbon - Field Operator - contractor

You will be required to work anywhere in the UK or Europe, for periods of up to 12 days in a row, during which Agricarbon will cover all expenses and provide an additional per diem allowance for European work.

Responsibilities

· Daily operation of soil sampling platform (ATV mounted, petrol/hydraulic-powered soil sampler).

· Collection of physical soil samples from pre-planned locations in line with mobile app/GPS

· Capture of all soil sample data via mobile app.

· Navigation from farm to farm, sometimes covering large distances.

· Navigation of farm and fields safely and respectfully

· Liaison with farmers to plan and confirm sampling visits, access to sites, any relevant matters

· Transportation of soil sampling equipment and consumables to site

· On-field troubleshooting

· Collating of soil cores in pallet crates

· Daily/weekly maintenance, upkeep and cleaning of soil extraction equipment

· Communication with Team Lead/Operations Manager with essential information, useful feedback, etc.

Skills and experience

You must have:

· Necessary practical skills to operate equipment alone

· A UK Cat B+E driving license (if you have a Cat B license, this can be automatically updated to B+E due to recent UK rules change)

· Understanding of H&S and evidence of being able to adhere to safety protocols

· Experience in basic vehicle/equipment maintenance

· A good level of physical fitness and resilience for working outdoors

Nice if you have

· First Aid trained

· Some experience operating hydraulic machinery

· Previous soil sampling experience

· Vehicle mechanic skills

· Experience towing trailers with heavy loads

· ATV off-road driving experience and well versed with the countryside code in the UK, or working in a farming environment

· IT and data entry skills on mobile phones and laptop

· Good communication skills

Personal characteristics

You are a highly self-motivated, self disciplined, friendly, punctual and diligent individual who takes pride in carrying out your work efficiently and to a high standard. You are proactive and hands-on, able to solve problems when they arise either independently or as part of a team. We hope you will be inspired by our mission and motivated to help the wider team succeed.

Application process

1. Email your CV and a covering note explaining why you believe you are a good fit for the role

2. Video call interview

3. Face to face interview and field trial

About Agricarbon UK

Agricarbon is an ambitious start-up in the fast-emerging soil carbon space. Demand for carbon removals is forecast to grow exponentially in the next few decades, and it has been estimated that agricultural soils have the capacity to capture up to 1 trillion tonnes of CO2 through regenerative farming practices.

Agricarbon develops innovative technology-based services that measure soil carbon with the highest level of accuracy and at ultra-low cost. This is a vital missing link to allow soil carbon capture projects to demonstrate and secure payments for CO2 removal, unlocking farm soils as a vast carbon sink opportunity. Our aim is to make a meaningful contribution to mitigating climate change within the next 10 years.

Based in Dundee, Scotland, Agricarbon is targeting established international carbon removal markets whilst simultaneously helping to develop the soil carbon market in the UK and Europe. Through science-led innovation in automation and systems engineering, Agricarbon aims to set a global gold standard for reliable, affordable soil carbon certification and unleash a new wave of climate mitigating regenerative farming practices.

We have recently completed Series A fundraising to scale our operations rapidly and have multiple contracts to fulfil for large food and beverage companies/project developers in the UK, Europe and internationally.

Role summary

This is an exciting opportunity to play a front line, hand’s-on role in operating Agricarbon’s cutting edge soil sampling platform and capability.

As a Field Operator you will report directly to the Field Operations Manager. You will operate Agricarbon’s on-field machinery (an ATV and rear mounted soil sampling machine) and primarily be responsible for the successful extraction of high quality soil cores with specialist equipment and collecting all associated data via a mobile app.

While you will work your own platform, you will often work together with another operator running a second platform on the same farm. You will be responsible for taking care of all your equipment, including daily and weekly maintenance. Comprehensive training will be provided by Agricarbon at the Dundee facility to cover all your delegated responsibilities.

You will work with and be supported by a wider support team in Agricarbon for all logistical requirements to ensure successful sampling operations. You will be required to work anywhere in the UK or Europe, for periods of up to 12 days in a row, during which Agricarbon will cover all expenses and provide an additional per diem allowance for European work.

· Daily operation of soil sampling platform (ATV mounted, petrol/hydraulic-powered soil sampler).

· Collection of physical soil samples from pre-planned locations in line with mobile app/GPS

· Capture of all soil sample data via mobile app.

· Navigation from farm to farm, sometimes covering large distances.

· Navigation of farm and fields safely and respectfully

· Liaison with farmers to plan and confirm sampling visits, access to sites, any relevant matters

· Transportation of soil sampling equipment and consumables to site

· On-field troubleshooting

· Collating of soil cores in pallet crates

· Daily/weekly maintenance, upkeep and cleaning of soil extraction equipment

· Communication with Team Lead/Operations Manager with essential information, useful feedback, etc.

Skills and experience

You must have:

· Necessary practical skills to operate equipment alone

· A UK Cat B+E driving license (if you have a Cat B license, this can be automatically updated to B+E due to recent UK rules change)

· Understanding of H&S and evidence of being able to adhere to safety protocols

· Experience in basic vehicle/equipment maintenance

· A good level of physical fitness and resilience for working outdoors

Nice if you have

· First Aid trained

· Some experience operating hydraulic machinery

· Previous soil sampling experience

· Vehicle mechanic skills

· Experience towing trailers with heavy loads

· ATV off-road driving experience and well versed with the countryside code in the UK, or working in a farming environment

· IT and data entry skills on mobile phones and laptop

· Good communication skills

Personal characteristics

You are a highly self-motivated, self disciplined, friendly, punctual and diligent individual who takes pride in carrying out your work efficiently and to a high standard. You are proactive and hands-on, able to solve problems when they arise either independently or as part of a team. We hope you will be inspired by our mission and motivated to help the wider team succeed.

2. Video call interview

3. Face to face interview and field trial

Reference ID: Agricarbon - Field Operator - contractor

title: Field Operator
description:
Job title: Field Operator - contractor

Location: UK and Europe (training and HQ at Dundee)

Term: Contractor basis

Salary: £250/day (+ additional per diem allowance of 190 euros/day for accommodation/subsistence during mainland European work only)

Dates: initial work throughout Feb – March 24. Follow on work TBC.

About Agricarbon UK

Agricarbon is an ambitious start-up in the fast-emerging soil carbon space. Demand for carbon removals is forecast to grow exponentially in the next few decades, and it has been estimated that agricultural soils have the capacity to capture up to 1 trillion tonnes of CO2 through regenerative farming practices.

Agricarbon develops innovative technology-based services that measure soil carbon with the highest level of accuracy and at ultra-low cost. This is a vital missing link to allow soil carbon capture projects to demonstrate and secure payments for CO2 removal, unlocking farm soils as a vast carbon sink opportunity. Our aim is to make a meaningful contribution to mitigating climate change within the next 10 years.

Based in Dundee, Scotland, Agricarbon is targeting established international carbon removal markets whilst simultaneously helping to develop the soil carbon market in the UK and Europe. Through science-led innovation in automation and systems engineering, Agricarbon aims to set a global gold standard for reliable, affordable soil carbon certification and unleash a new wave of climate mitigating regenerative farming practices.

We have recently completed Series A fundraising to scale our operations rapidly and have multiple contracts to fulfil for large food and beverage companies/project developers in the UK, Europe and internationally.

Role summary

This is an exciting opportunity to play a front line, hand’s-on role in operating Agricarbon’s cutting edge soil sampling platform and capability.

As a Field Operator you will report directly to the Field Operations Manager. You will operate Agricarbon’s on-field machinery (an ATV and rear mounted soil sampling machine) and primarily be responsible for the successful extraction of high quality soil cores with specialist equipment and collecting all associated data via a mobile app.

While you will work your own platform, you will often work together with another operator running a second platform on the same farm. You will be responsible for taking care of all your equipment, including daily and weekly maintenance. Comprehensive training will be provided by Agricarbon at the Dundee facility to cover all your delegated responsibilities.

You will work with and be supported by a wider support team in Agricarbon for all logistical requirements to ensure successful sampling operations. You will be required to work anywhere in the UK or Europe, for periods of up to 12 days in a row, during which Agricarbon will cover all expenses and provide an additional per diem allowance for European work.

Responsibilities

· Daily operation of soil sampling platform (ATV mounted, petrol/hydraulic-powered soil sampler).

· Collection of physical soil samples from pre-planned locations in line with mobile app/GPS

· Capture of all soil sample data via mobile app.

· Navigation from farm to farm, sometimes covering large distances.

· Navigation of farm and fields safely and respectfully

· Liaison with farmers to plan and confirm sampling visits, access to sites, any relevant matters

· Transportation of soil sampling equipment and consumables to site

· On-field troubleshooting

· Collating of soil cores in pallet crates

· Daily/weekly maintenance, upkeep and cleaning of soil extraction equipment

· Communication with Team Lead/Operations Manager with essential information, useful feedback, etc.

Skills and experience

You must have:

· Necessary practical skills to operate equipment alone

· A UK Cat B+E driving license (if you have a Cat B license, this can be automatically updated to B+E due to recent UK rules change)

· Understanding of H&S and evidence of being able to adhere to safety protocols

· Experience in basic vehicle/equipment maintenance

· A good level of physical fitness and resilience for working outdoors

Nice if you have

· First Aid trained

· Some experience operating hydraulic machinery

· Previous soil sampling experience

· Vehicle mechanic skills

· Experience towing trailers with heavy loads

· ATV off-road driving experience and well versed with the countryside code in the UK, or working in a farming environment

· IT and data entry skills on mobile phones and laptop

· Good communication skills

Personal characteristics

You are a highly self-motivated, self disciplined, friendly, punctual and diligent individual who takes pride in carrying out your work efficiently and to a high standard. You are proactive and hands-on, able to solve problems when they arise either independently or as part of a team. We hope you will be inspired by our mission and motivated to help the wider team succeed.

Application process

1. Email your CV and a covering note explaining why you believe you are a good fit for the role

2. Video call interview

3. Face to face interview and field trial

Job Types: Temporary contract, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 2 months

Salary: £250.00 per day

Benefits:

  • Free or subsidised travel

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Licence/Certification:

  • Driving Licence (required)

Willingness to travel:

  • 100% (required)

Work Location: On the road

While you will work your own platform, you will often work together with another operator running a second platform on the same farm. You will be responsible for taking care of all your equipment, including daily and weekly maintenance. Comprehensive training will be provided by Agricarbon at the Dundee facility to cover all your delegated responsibilities.

You will work with and be supported by a wider support team in Agricarbon for all logistical requirements to ensure successful sampling operations. You will be required to work anywhere in the UK or Europe, for periods of up to 12 days in a row, during which Agricarbon will cover all expenses and provide an additional per diem allowance for European work.

Responsibilities

· Daily operation of soil sampling platform (ATV mounted, petrol/hydraulic-powered soil sampler).

· Collection of physical soil samples from pre-planned locations in line with mobile app/GPS

· Capture of all soil sample data via mobile app.

· Navigation from farm to farm, sometimes covering large distances.

· Navigation of farm and fields safely and respectfully

· Liaison with farmers to plan and confirm sampling visits, access to sites, any relevant matters

· Transportation of soil sampling equipment and consumables to site

· On-field troubleshooting

· Collating of soil cores in pallet crates

· Daily/weekly maintenance, upkeep and cleaning of soil extraction equipment

· Communication with Team Lead/Operations Manager with essential information, useful feedback, etc.

Skills and experience

You must have:

· Necessary practical skills to operate equipment alone

· A UK Cat B+E driving license (if you have a Cat B license, this can be automatically updated to B+E due to recent UK rules change)

· Understanding of H&S and evidence of being able to adhere to safety protocols

· Experience in basic vehicle/equipment maintenance

· A good level of physical fitness and resilience for working outdoors

Nice if you have

· First Aid trained

· Some experience operating hydraulic machinery

· Previous soil sampling experience

· Vehicle mechanic skills

· Experience towing trailers with heavy loads

· ATV off-road driving experience and well versed with the countryside code in the UK, or working in a farming environment

· IT and data entry skills on mobile phones and laptop

· Good communication skills

Personal characteristics

You are a highly self-motivated, self disciplined, friendly, punctual and diligent individual who takes pride in carrying out your work efficiently and to a high standard. You are proactive and hands-on, able to solve problems when they arise either independently or as part of a team. We hope you will be inspired by our mission and motivated to help the wider team succeed.

Application process

1. Email your CV and a covering note explaining why you believe you are a good fit for the role

2. Video call interview

3. Face to face interview and field trial

Job Types: Temporary contract, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 2 months

Salary: £250.00 per day

Benefits:

  • Free or subsidised travel

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Licence/Certification:

  • Driving Licence (required)

Willingness to travel:

  • 100% (required)

Work Location: On the road

About Agricarbon UK

Agricarbon is an ambitious start-up in the fast-emerging soil carbon space. Demand for carbon removals is forecast to grow exponentially in the next few decades, and it has been estimated that agricultural soils have the capacity to capture up to 1 trillion tonnes of CO2 through regenerative farming practices.

Agricarbon develops innovative technology-based services that measure soil carbon with the highest level of accuracy and at ultra-low cost. This is a vital missing link to allow soil carbon capture projects to demonstrate and secure payments for CO2 removal, unlocking farm soils as a vast carbon sink opportunity. Our aim is to make a meaningful contribution to mitigating climate change within the next 10 years.

Based in Dundee, Scotland, Agricarbon is targeting established international carbon removal markets whilst simultaneously helping to develop the soil carbon market in the UK and Europe. Through science-led innovation in automation and systems engineering, Agricarbon aims to set a global gold standard for reliable, affordable soil carbon certification and unleash a new wave of climate mitigating regenerative farming practices.

We have recently completed Series A fundraising to scale our operations rapidly and have multiple contracts to fulfil for large food and beverage companies/project developers in the UK, Europe and internationally.

You are proactive and hands-on, able to solve problems when they arise either independently or as part of a team. We hope you will be inspired by our mission and motivated to help the wider team succeed.

3. Face to face interview and field trial

title: Field Operator
description:
Job title: Field Operator - contractor

Location: UK and Europe (training and HQ at Dundee)

Term: Contractor basis

Salary: £250/day (+ additional per diem allowance of 190 euros/day for accommodation/subsistence during mainland European work only)

Dates: initial work throughout Feb – March 24. Follow on work TBC.

About Agricarbon UK

Agricarbon is an ambitious start-up in the fast-emerging soil carbon space. Demand for carbon removals is forecast to grow exponentially in the next few decades, and it has been estimated that agricultural soils have the capacity to capture up to 1 trillion tonnes of CO2 through regenerative farming practices.

Agricarbon develops innovative technology-based services that measure soil carbon with the highest level of accuracy and at ultra-low cost. This is a vital missing link to allow soil carbon capture projects to demonstrate and secure payments for CO2 removal, unlocking farm soils as a vast carbon sink opportunity. Our aim is to make a meaningful contribution to mitigating climate change within the next 10 years.

Based in Dundee, Scotland, Agricarbon is targeting established international carbon removal markets whilst simultaneously helping to develop the soil carbon market in the UK and Europe. Through science-led innovation in automation and systems engineering, Agricarbon aims to set a global gold standard for reliable, affordable soil carbon certification and unleash a new wave of climate mitigating regenerative farming practices.

We have recently completed Series A fundraising to scale our operations rapidly and have multiple contracts to fulfil for large food and beverage companies/project developers in the UK, Europe and internationally.

Role summary

This is an exciting opportunity to play a front line, hand’s-on role in operating Agricarbon’s cutting edge soil sampling platform and capability.

As a Field Operator you will report directly to the Field Operations Manager. You will operate Agricarbon’s on-field machinery (an ATV and rear mounted soil sampling machine) and primarily be responsible for the successful extraction of high quality soil cores with specialist equipment and collecting all associated data via a mobile app.

While you will work your own platform, you will often work together with another operator running a second platform on the same farm. You will be responsible for taking care of all your equipment, including daily and weekly maintenance. Comprehensive training will be provided by Agricarbon at the Dundee facility to cover all your delegated responsibilities.

You will work with and be supported by a wider support team in Agricarbon for all logistical requirements to ensure successful sampling operations. You will be required to work anywhere in the UK or Europe, for periods of up to 12 days in a row, during which Agricarbon will cover all expenses and provide an additional per diem allowance for European work.

Responsibilities

· Daily operation of soil sampling platform (ATV mounted, petrol/hydraulic-powered soil sampler).

· Collection of physical soil samples from pre-planned locations in line with mobile app/GPS

· Capture of all soil sample data via mobile app.

· Navigation from farm to farm, sometimes covering large distances.

· Navigation of farm and fields safely and respectfully

· Liaison with farmers to plan and confirm sampling visits, access to sites, any relevant matters

· Transportation of soil sampling equipment and consumables to site

· On-field troubleshooting

· Collating of soil cores in pallet crates

· Daily/weekly maintenance, upkeep and cleaning of soil extraction equipment

· Communication with Team Lead/Operations Manager with essential information, useful feedback, etc.

Skills and experience

You must have:

· Necessary practical skills to operate equipment alone

· A UK Cat B+E driving license (if you have a Cat B license, this can be automatically updated to B+E due to recent UK rules change)

· Understanding of H&S and evidence of being able to adhere to safety protocols

· Experience in basic vehicle/equipment maintenance

· A good level of physical fitness and resilience for working outdoors

Nice if you have

· First Aid trained

· Some experience operating hydraulic machinery

· Previous soil sampling experience

· Vehicle mechanic skills

· Experience towing trailers with heavy loads

· ATV off-road driving experience and well versed with the countryside code in the UK, or working in a farming environment

· IT and data entry skills on mobile phones and laptop

· Good communication skills

Personal characteristics

You are a highly self-motivated, self disciplined, friendly, punctual and diligent individual who takes pride in carrying out your work efficiently and to a high standard. You are proactive and hands-on, able to solve problems when they arise either independently or as part of a team. We hope you will be inspired by our mission and motivated to help the wider team succeed.

Application process

1. Email your CV and a covering note explaining why you believe you are a good fit for the role

2. Video call interview

3. Face to face interview and field trial

Job Types: Temporary contract, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 2 months

Salary: £250.00 per day

Benefits:

  • Free or subsidised travel

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday
  • Weekend availability

Licence/Certification:

  • Driving Licence (required)

Willingness to travel:

  • 100% (required)

Work Location: On the road
